org.cougaar.lib.web.micro.http
Class HttpServletEngine

java.lang.Object
  org.cougaar.util.GenericStateModelAdapter
      org.cougaar.lib.web.engine.AbstractServletEngine
          org.cougaar.lib.web.micro.http.HttpServletEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component, GenericStateModel
public class HttpServletEngine
extends AbstractServletEngine

This component creates a minimal servlet engine based on the trimmed-down ServletEngineImpl implementation.

This implementation is intended as a drop-in replacement for the heavier-weight, Tomcat-based "webtomcat" servlet engine.

configure

protected void configure(int httpPort,
                         int httpsPort,
                         java.util.Map options)
Description copied from class: AbstractServletEngine
Set the HTTP and HTTPS (SSL) configuration -- this is called before AbstractServletEngine.startServer().

Specified by:
configure in class AbstractServletEngine
Parameters:
httpPort - the HTTP port, or -1 if HTTP is disabled
httpsPort - the HTTPS port, or -1 if HTTP is disabled
options - a Map of String keys to String values that specify additional server options (e.g. "http.acceptCount").

startServer

protected void startServer()
                    throws java.net.BindException,
                           java.io.IOException
Description copied from class: AbstractServletEngine
Start the server.

Specified by:
startServer in class AbstractServletEngine
Throws:
java.net.BindException - if the either the HTTP or HTTPS port is already in use. The base class will then call "configure" with different port(s) and try to start again.
java.io.IOException - some other server exception occurred.

setGateway

protected void setGateway(javax.servlet.Servlet s)
                   throws javax.servlet.ServletException
Description copied from class: AbstractServletEngine
Set the single Servlet that will handle all service requests for the running server.

Even though this is defined as setGateway(Servlet), all calls to:

  Servlet.service(ServletRequest, ServletResponse)
 must pass in the HTTP subclasses of these request/response interfaces:
  Servlet.service(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse)
, since this is an HTTP/HTTPS server engine.

Specified by:
setGateway in class AbstractServletEngine
Throws:
javax.servlet.ServletException

stopServer

protected void stopServer()
Description copied from class: AbstractServletEngine
Stop the server.

This is only called if AbstractServletEngine.startServer() was called and didn't throw an exception.

Specified by:
stopServer in class AbstractServletEngine
